newsitem.title: USA: Panthers to buy Boca Raton Hotel for $325 million.
newsitem.headline: Panthers to buy Boca Raton Hotel for $325 million.

text.p: Florida Panthers Holdings Inc., owner of the Florida Panthers Hockey Club, said Friday it agreed to acquire the assets and liabilities of the Boca Raton Hotel & Club.
The transaction is valued at $325 million, the company said.

The Boca Raton Resort & Club, located in Boca Raton, Fla., has 963 rooms, including a separate beach club containing 214 guest rooms and golf, tennis, a full-service marina, water sports, state-of-the-art fitness centres and other facilities.

By year-end, it is scheduled to complete a $40 million expansion and renovation plan begun in mid-1996. Included in the plan are a new 130,000 square-foot conference facility, a new tennis and fitness centre complex and certain other significant improvements.

Florida Panthers Holdings also owns the Arena Development and Arena Operating Co., the Hyatt Regency Pier 66 Resort and Marina, the Radisson Bahia Mar Resort and Yachting Centre, Incredible Ice Skating Rinks and an interest in the Miami Arena.
The latest deal will result in the issuance of about 4.9 million class A common shares, warrants to purchase about 980,000 additional shares and assumption of all liabilities.
Panthers stock gained $1.625 to $28 in midday trading on Nasdaq.
